titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 652) to provide for a pro-competitive, de-regulatory national policy framework designed to accelerate rapidly private sector deployment of advanced telecommunications and information technologies and services to all Americans by opening all telecommunications markets to competition, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-459, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to S. 652. All points of order against the conference report and against its consideragion shall be waived. Conference report shall be considered as read.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 182.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 337 - 80 (Roll no. 24).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 1/31/1996--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on S. 652 (telecommunications competition and technology).
